column4: evening all, how is everyone, i have had a rough ubuntu weekend but all is good now, havea  wacom tablet that works, but,. im trying to get the buttons on the pad to work and im doing this walkthrough http://cgi.feureau.com/2008/02/how-to-get-wacom-tablet-fully-working.html
however im stuck at the            make           make install bit
seems i cant make, or make install
thanks
actually, sorry, HappyHater, what does that mean
okasa,
manlymatt83, no idea where the asa came from
happyhater and rick-u64 sorry done, ive had it installed
done
im following that walkthrough step by step
is it MAKEFILE in all capitals, or is it "Makefile" with just a capital M?
just the first letter is a caps
that's how it's supposed to be then
the instructions say to cd to the dir
yes, that means you need to type "cd path/to/directory" replacing path/to/directory with the path to the folder you want
then            ./configure            and then            make         and then         make install   , but when i do it says no make file found
did the ./configure part work?
then the make part ought to work as well
http://pastebin.com/m14845145 this is whats happenin
if you'd read the output of ./configure you'd see it complaining
im on it, sorry dont really know enough yet
I suggest trying: sudo apt-get install libxtst-dev
everything there was fine until line 53: "Can not link with Xtst /usr/lib/libXtst.so library!"
